name: NHS Health Check Record Standard
description:
NHS Health Check Record Standard

V0.1.0 First draft

V0.1.1 SNOMED CT Codes updated and incremented to V0.1.1

V0.1.2 SNOMED CT codes updated following October 24 release, and incremented to V0.1.2

V1.0.0 Plan and requested actions section updated, and new SNOMED CT codes added to this section. Incremented to V1.0.0 following end of endorsement period.

concept.name: Person demographics
concept.implementationGuidance: This section contains the person’s demographic and contact details including key identifiers (e.g. name, date of birth, NHS number, address etc.). Personal Demographic Service (PDS) will be used as the source of information to ensure the elements within this section can be fulfilled (England and Wales only). The information under this heading will be populated from the PDS. NHS Spine compliant systems are needed to obtain traced NHS Numbers. Where an organisation does not have a system linked to the PDS, other demographic fields will need to be used, with local person identity matching software. A history of Local Patient Identifiers should be kept so it is important to understand the organisation which assigned the Local Patient Identifier.
concept.description: The person's details and contact information.

concept.implementationGuidance: Details of the person's name.
concept.description: Details of the person's name.

concept.name: Person first name
concept.implementationGuidance: The first name(s) of the person. This includes middle names.
concept.description: The first name(s) of the person. This includes middle names.

concept.implementationGuidance: The family name or surname of the person.
concept.description: The family name or surname of the person.

concept.name: Person preferred name
concept.implementationGuidance: The name by which a person wishes to be addressed. The preferred name volunteered by the person or a preferred name given by PDS that the person has asked to be called by.
concept.description: The name by which a person wishes to be addressed. The preferred name volunteered by the person or a preferred name given by PDS that the person has asked to be called by.
concept.valueSets: NHS data dictionary : - Person full name

concept.description: A textual suffix that may be added to the end of a person's name, for example, OBE, MBE, BSc, JP, GM, etc.
concept.valueSets: NHS data dictionary : - Person name suffix

concept.name: Gender
concept.implementationGuidance: The definitions used for phenotypic sex and gender use the NHS data dictionary definitions to ensure interoperability with other systems. However, we recognise that the definitions used do not reflect today’s more inclusive society. We have provided feedback on this to NHS data dictionary team who are actively addressing this area, and any updates to the NHS data dictionary will update our standards. Phenotypic sex and gender data items may cause accidental disclosure of gender reassignment without consent. This is because both fields are included in the demographic model. Having both may show a difference and therefore disclose gender reassignment without consent. It is unlawful to disclose, without consent, a person’s gender reassignment with or without a gender reassignment certificate Section 22 of the Gender Reassignment Act 2004 makes it an offence to disclose the history of a transgender patient who has had formal gender reassignment under the Act, unless consent has been sought. The exemption of disclosure is for medical professionals involved in direct medical care, but not currently for administrative and non-medical staff. For the full Act, see https://www.legislation.gov.uk/ukpga/2004/7/contents. This risk can be mitigated by appropriate implementation in a shared care record; refer to the clinical safety case report and hazard log. One option is to leave out the “Phenotypic Sex” field but the implications and potential risks of that will need to be considered. The alternative is to ensure the design of the Shared Care Record, including its Information Governance model, reduces this risk to an acceptable level as described in the clinical safety case and hazard log. A further mitigation on implementation could be to record self-expressed gender in the administrative area of systems, and record sex at birth in a separate clinical area, that can only be accessed by medical staff.
concept.description: The person's stated gender.
concept.valueSets: NHS data dictionary : - Person stated gender code

concept.name: Ethnicity
concept.implementationGuidance: Once approved by the Data Alliance Partnership Board, the Ethnic Category 2021 reference set should be used for this element. Find a link to the placeholder webpage here: https://www.datadictionary.nhs.uk/attributes/ethnic_category_2021.html
concept.description: The ethnicity of the person as specified by the person.
concept.valueSets: NHS data dictionary :- Ethnic category

concept.name: Phenotypic sex
concept.implementationGuidance: The definitions used for phenotypic sex and gender use the NHS data dictionary definitions to ensure interoperability with other systems. However, we recognise that the definitions used do not reflect today’s more inclusive society. We have provided feedback on this to NHS data dictionary team who are actively addressing this area, and any updates to the NHS data dictionary will update our standards. Phenotypic sex and gender data items may cause accidental disclosure of gender reassignment without consent. This is because both fields are included in the demographic model. Having both may show a difference and therefore disclose gender reassignment without consent. It is unlawful to disclose, without consent, a person’s gender reassignment with or without a gender reassignment certificate Section 22 of the Gender Reassignment Act 2004 makes it an offence to disclose the history of a transgender patient who has had formal gender reassignment under the Act, unless consent has been sought. The exemption of disclosure is for medical professionals involved in direct medical care, but not currently for administrative and non-medical staff. For the full Act, see https://www.legislation.gov.uk/ukpga/2004/7/contents. This risk can be mitigated by appropriate implementation in a shared care record; refer to the clinical safety case report and hazard log. One option is to leave out the “Phenotypic Sex” field but the implications and potential risks of that will need to be considered. The alternative is to ensure the design of the Shared Care Record, including its Information Governance model, reduces this risk to an acceptable level as described in the clinical safety case and hazard log. A further mitigation on implementation could be to record self-expressed gender in the administrative area of systems, and record sex at birth in a separate clinical area, that can only be accessed by medical staff.
concept.description: The phenotypic sex of the individual. This is the observed sex of a person at birth.

concept.name: Coded value
concept.implementationGuidance: NHS Data Dictionary: PERSON PHENOTYPIC SEX
concept.description: The coded value for phenotypic sex.
concept.valueSets: NHS Data dictionary : - Person phenotypic sex

concept.name: Free text
concept.implementationGuidance: Free text field to be used if no code is available.
concept.description: Free text field to be used if no code is available.

concept.name: Social context
concept.implementationGuidance: This section includes information about the social circumstances in which the person lives, such as their smoking status and alcohol intake levels.
concept.description: The social setting in which the person lives, such as their household, occupational history, and lifestyle factors.

concept.implementationGuidance: Details of the person's smoking status.
concept.description: Details of the person's smoking status.

concept.name: Smoking status
concept.implementationGuidance: Record of any smoking use by the person.
concept.description: Record of any smoking use by the person.

266919005 Never smoked tobacco (finding)

8392000 Non-smoker (finding)

8517006 Ex-smoker (finding)

160603005 Light cigarette smoker (1-9 cigs/day) (finding)

160604004 Moderate cigarette smoker (10-19 cigs/day) (finding)

56771006 Heavy smoker (over 20 per day) (finding)
concept.description: The smoking status of the person.
concept.valueSets:

^999000891000000102 |Smoking simple reference set (foundation metadata concept)|

concept.name: Family history
concept.implementationGuidance: This section includes information on conditions or illness in family relations relevant to the health or care of the person. For the NHS Health Check, relevant conditions are family history of angina or heart attack in a first degree relative at less than 60 years old, and family history of diabetes.
concept.description: Family history

concept.name: Family history record entry
concept.implementationGuidance: This is a family history record entry. There may be 0 to many record entry/entries under a section. Each record entry is made up of a number of elements or data items.
concept.description: This is a family history record entry. There may be 0 to many record entry/entries under a section. Each record entry is made up of a number of elements or data items.

concept.name: Family history
concept.implementationGuidance: The record of relevant illness in family relations deemed to be significant to the care or health of the person, including mental illness and suicide, genetic information etc.
concept.description: The record of relevant illness in family relations deemed to be significant to the care or health of the person, including mental illness and suicide, genetic information etc.

concept.name: Coded value
concept.implementationGuidance:
Please note that further codes have been requested through SNOMED CT's request portal for this standard and data item, once approved the new code(s) will be added to the standard via a minor implementation guidance update.

266895004 |Family history: Ischemic heart disease at less than 60 years (situation)|

266882009 |No family history: Ischemic heart disease (situation)|

266896003 |Family history: Ischemic heart disease at greater than 60 years (situation)|

160274005 |No family history diabetes (situation)|

160303001 |Family history of diabetes mellitus (situation)|

430678008 |Family history of diabetes mellitus type 1 (situation)|

430679000 |Family history of diabetes mellitus type 2 (situation)|
concept.description: The coded value for family history
concept.valueSets: SNOMED CT:- <404684003 |Clinical finding (finding)| OR <243796009 |Situation with explicit context (situation)|

concept.name: Observations
concept.implementationGuidance: This section includes a record of essential physiological measurements, e.g., height, weight, waist circumference, body mass index (BMI), blood pressure, pulse. Where a SNOMED CT observable entity code is recorded in relation to the quality/property observed, an associated paired value and UCUM unit of measurement must also be recorded and accompany the recorded code. An observation for ‘BMI’ must be populated if a height and weight are recorded. Both the diastolic and systolic elements of the blood pressure reading must be recorded together. Both the heart rate and pulse characteristics elements of the pulse reading must be recorded together.
concept.description: The record of essential physiological measurements, e.g., heart rate, blood pressure, temperature, pulse, height, weight, respiratory rate, oxygen saturation.

concept.name: Assessments
concept.implementationGuidance: This section allows for the recording of the results of any assessments completed. The results of any assessments completed must be displayed under this section. This is an example list of assessment scales that may be used in the NHS Health Check and may be recorded under this section: QRISK3, Leicester Diabetes, UK Diabetes, Q Diabetes, FAST, AUDIT C, AUDIT, General Practice Physical Activity Questionnaire.
concept.description: Details of the person's assessments

concept.name: Structured assessment record entry
concept.implementationGuidance: This is the structured assessments record entry. There may be 0 to many record entry/entries under a section. Each record entry is made up of a number of elements or data items.
concept.description: This is the structured assessments record entry. There may be 0 to many record entry/entries under a section. Each record entry is made up of a number of elements or data items.

concept.name: Problem list
concept.implementationGuidance: This section allows for the recording of all relevant diagnoses and problems and issues. The naming of this section may be displayed differently in a system if it is felt that the current wording of ‘problem list’ has negative connotations.
concept.description: A summary of the problems that require investigation or treatment.

concept.name: Problem list record entry
concept.implementationGuidance:
This is a problem list record entry. 
                         
 There may be 0 to many record entries under problem list. 
                         
 Each record entry is made up of a number of elements or data items.
concept.description:
This is a problem list record entry.  <br clear="none"/> 
                         <br clear="none"/>  There may be 0 to many record entries under problem list.  <br clear="none"/> 
                         <br clear="none"/>  Each record entry is made up of a number of elements or data items.

concept.name: Problem
concept.implementationGuidance:
A condition which needs addressing and so is important for every professional to know about when seeing the person. 
                             
 Problems may include diagnoses, symptoms, and social or behavioural issues
concept.description:
A condition which needs addressing and so is important for every professional to know about when seeing the person.  <br clear="none"/> 
                             <br clear="none"/>  Problems may include diagnoses, symptoms, and social or behavioural issues

concept.name: Investigation results
concept.implementationGuidance: This section allows for the recording of the results of any investigation results. This is an example list of investigations that may be conducted during the NHS Health Check and whose results may be recorded under this section: Lipid results, HbA1C results for diabetes testing.
concept.description: Investigation results

concept.name: Diagnostic report conclusion
concept.implementationGuidance: Concise and clinically contextualized summary conclusion (interpretation/impression) of the diagnostic report.
concept.description: Concise and clinically contextualized summary conclusion (interpretation/impression) of the diagnostic report.

concept.name: Diagnostic report group
concept.implementationGuidance:
A test report, containing the overall findings and clinical interpretation relating to one or more pathology tests. The report may reference individual test results, test groups or a combination of these.
                             
Refer to the Pathology Implementation Guide for further information ([https://simplifier.net/guide/pathology-fhir-implementation-guide/Home/FHIRAssets/AllAssets/All-Profiles/UKCore-DiagnosticReport-Lab?version=0.1](https://simplifier.net/guide/pathology-fhir-implementation-guide/Home/FHIRAssets/AllAssets/All-Profiles/UKCore-DiagnosticReport-Lab?version=0.1))
concept.description:
A test report, containing the overall findings and clinical interpretation relating to one or more pathology tests. The report may reference individual test results, test groups or a combination of these.

concept.name: Information and advice given
concept.implementationGuidance: This section should be used to record advice given to the person following findings from their NHS Health Check. Where the person is provided with literature (e.g. pamphlets) there is no need to provide details of the information contained in the literature e.g. simply state that the person was provided with a pamphlet on the topic it discusses, such as smoking cessation. In some instances health care professionals may want to communicate the specific information and advice which was given to the person. It is important that this is concise and is only information which it is pertinent to be aware of.
concept.description: Information and advice given.

concept.name: Information and advice given
concept.implementationGuidance: The oral, written, or multi-media information or advice given to the person, carer, other authorised representative, care professional or other third party. May include advice about actions related to medicines or other ongoing care activities on an ‘information prescription'. State here if there are concerns about the extent to which the person and/or carer understand                             the information provided about diagnosis, prognosis and treatment.
concept.description: The oral, written, or multi-media information or advice given to the person, carer, other authorised representative, care professional or other third party. May include advice about actions related to medicines or other ongoing care activities on an ‘information prescription'. State here if there are concerns about the extent to which the person and/or carer understand the information provided about diagnosis, prognosis and treatment.

concept.description:

concept.name: Role
concept.implementationGuidance: Role of the referrer.
concept.description: Role of the referrer.
concept.valueSets:
Alignment to the workforce dataset NHS Occupation codes primarily is advised. Where no code is available, free text may be used.

National Workforce Data Set (NWD) NHS Occupation codes are found here: - https://digital.nhs.uk/data-and-information/data-collections-and-data-sets/data-sets/national-workforce-data-set-nwd-and-nhs-occupation-codes. To access the list of roles, download the 'NWD dataset specification' using the link on the page.

The Staff Groups and Job Roles are listed in the ‘NWD Class & Codes Appendix’ tab of the attached NWD Dataset from row 640. The 'Staff Group' and 'Job Role' segments are contained in one field named 'Job' which work together e.g. Staff Group = Nursing & Midwifery Registered and Job Role = Staff Nurse.

concept.name: Plan and requested actions
concept.implementationGuidance: This is the treatment plan for the treating team or clinician and any actions requested. This plan should make clear who is expected to take responsibility for actions following an encounter, for example the person receiving care or their carer; the GP or another heath care professional. Shared decision-making principles should apply to the development of the plan and where the person’s opinions differ, this should be included under ‘Agreed with the person or their legitimate person representative’ which will include both the aspects of the plan the person (or their representative) agree with and the aspects they disagree with. The section allows for the recording of planned investigations, procedures and treatment for the person’s identified conditions and priorities. This is not a care plan it is a plan for specific actions to be carried out as a result of an encounter.
concept.description: The details of planned investigations, procedures and treatment, and whether this plan has been agreed with the person or their legitimate representative.

concept.name: Plan and requested actions record entry
concept.implementationGuidance: This is a plan and requested actions record entry. There may be 0 to many record entries under a section. Each record entry is made up of a number of elements or data items.
concept.description: This is a plan and requested actions record entry. There may be 0 to many record entries under a section. Each record entry is made up of a number of elements or data items.

concept.name: Actions for professionals
concept.implementationGuidance: For each action the following should be identified: a) person responsible - name and designation / department / hospital / patient etc or role (eg GP) responsible for carrying out the proposed action, and where action should take place.b) status - requested, planned or completed. c) When action requested for - requested date, time, or period - as relevant. d) suggested strategies - suggested strategies for potential problems. e) outcome expectations, including patient’s expectations.
concept.description: For each action the following should be identified: a) person responsible - name and designation / department / hospital / patient etc or role (eg GP) responsible for carrying out the proposed action, and where action should take place.b) status - requested, planned or completed. c) When action requested for - requested date, time, or period - as relevant. d) suggested strategies - suggested strategies for potential problems. e) outcome expectations, including patient’s expectations.

concept.name: Strategies
concept.implementationGuidance: Details of any strategies to be used to complete the actions.
concept.description: Details of any strategies to be used to complete the actions.

concept.name: Actions for person or their carer
concept.implementationGuidance: For each action the following should be identified: a) person responsible - name and designation / department / hospital / patient etc or role (eg GP) responsible for carrying out the proposed action, and where action should take place.b) status - requested, planned or completed. c) When action requested for - requested date, time, or period - as relevant. d) suggested strategies - suggested strategies for potential problems. e) outcome expectations, including patient’s expectations.
concept.description: For each action the following should be identified: a) person responsible - name and designation / department / hospital / patient etc or role (eg GP) responsible for carrying out the proposed action, and where action should take place.b) status - requested, planned or completed. c) When action requested for - requested date, time, or period - as relevant. d) suggested strategies - suggested strategies for potential problems. e) outcome expectations, including patient’s expectations.

concept.name: Actions
concept.implementationGuidance: Including planned investigations, procedures, Interventions and treatment for a patient’s identified conditions and priorities. For each action the following should be identified: a) person responsible - name and designation / department / hospital / patient etc or role (eg GP) responsible for carrying out                                     the proposed action, and where action should take place.b) status - requested, planned or completed. c) When action requested for - requested date, time, or period - as relevant. d) suggested strategies - suggested strategies for potential problems. e) outcome expectations, including patient’s expectations.
concept.description:
Including planned investigations, procedures, Interventions and treatment for a patient’s identified conditions and priorities. For each action the following should be identified: a) person responsible - name and designation / department / hospital / patient etc or role (eg GP) responsible for carrying out
                                    the proposed action, and where action should take place.b) status - requested, planned or completed. c) When action requested for - requested date, time, or period - as relevant. d) suggested strategies - suggested strategies for potential problems. e) outcome expectations, including patient’s expectations.

concept.name: Role
concept.implementationGuidance: The relation to the person e.g. father, cousin etc
concept.description: The relation to the person e.g. father, cousin etc

concept.name: Relationship
concept.implementationGuidance: The relationship the carer has to the person, e.g. father, grandmother, family friend etc. This should be completed if the action is for the person's carer, rather than for the person themselves.
concept.description: The relationship the carer has to the person, e.g. father, grandmother, family friend etc. This should be completed if the action is for the person's carer, rather than for the person themselves.

concept.name: Coded value
concept.implementationGuidance: The coded value for relationship.
concept.description: The coded value for relationship.
concept.valueSets: Nationally or internationally maintained code system(s) (see implementation guidance).

concept.implementationGuidance: Free text field to be used if no code is available.

concept.description: The date that the action should be completed by.

concept.name: Status
concept.implementationGuidance: Status of the action
concept.description: Status of the action

concept.name: Priority
concept.implementationGuidance: This is the priority of the action to be completed.

concept.implementationGuidance: This includes a name or description of the investigation requested and the date requested.

concept.name: Procedures requested
concept.implementationGuidance: These are the diagnostic or therapeutic procedures that have actually been requested (and the date requested).
